children.text: This dwelling is in a designated termite zone, and there does not appear to have been a termite barrier installed on the boundary line, so therefore cannot have an external reticulation or spray system installed along its outer face.
Part 3.1.4.3 Termite management systems of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that
‘Where a termite management system is required it must comply with AS 3660.1’ .
Section 1.5, Construction at Or Near Boundary of the relevant Australian Standard AS 3660.1 Termite Management Part 1 New Work requires that
‘A perimeter barrier shall be installed to the construction at or near the boundary’ .

As the building permit approved drawings show that termite protection is part of these contract works, the edge of the floor slab along this boundary will need to be treated and made compliant with the requirements of the BCA and AS 3660.1 Termite Management. The builder should either provide evidence that this area has been treated, or alternatively arrange for the appropriate termite protection to be installed to protect this home.
